intro: Triplaris moyobambensis, commonly known as the Moyobamba triplaris, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest in South America. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is typically found in humid, shaded environments. Its fruits are small, woody capsules that contain several seeds, contributing to its role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
